meanings.definition: To spray or douse with water from a hose.
meanings.sent1: I was hosing the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter was hosing down the burning house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog started hosing everyone during the water fight.
meanings.sent4: The rain was hosing down on the roof, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The car wash was hosing the vehicles with soapy water.

meanings.sent1: The gardener used a long hosing to water the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The hosing in the backyard was leaking and needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the hosing was a snake in their imaginative game.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter grabbed the hosing to connect it to the hydrant.
meanings.sent5: The hosing was neatly coiled up next to the shed.

meanings.sent1: The scammer was hosing innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent2: He realized too late that the salesman was hosing him with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he would try to hose the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was hosing unsuspecting tourists with his fake lottery scheme.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest mechanic was hosing customers by overcharging for repairs.
